title: OpenSSL checks are too slow
body:
I often work on systems that can't see the outside world.  On such systems, everytime spack queries the OpenSSL package, a 2 minute delay is added to my command.  For example:

```
% time spack spec openssl%intel@16.0.3
<output trimmed>
==> Warning: This installation depends on an old version of OpenSSL, which may have known security issues. 
==> Warning: Consider updating to the latest version of this package.
==> Warning: More details at http://www.openssl.org
<output trimmed>

real    2m9.064s
user    0m0.632s
sys 0m0.216s
```

Also:

```
% spack -p spec openssl%intel@16.0.3
  ncalls  tottime  percall  cumtime  percall filename:lineno(function)
        1  127.316  127.316  127.316  127.316 {method 'connect' of '_socket.socket' objects}
        3    0.689    0.230    0.689    0.230 {built-in method poll}
<output trimmed>

```

Is there any way to disable this check? or make it time-out after 15-20 seconds?  For now, I just comment out this section of openssl/package.py.
